title: Honoring Dr. W. Ruth Whitney upon the occasion of her Installation as President of the New York State Ministers' Wives and Ministers' Widows Association, Inc.
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Dr. W. Ruth Whitney upon the occasion of
her  Installation as the 13th President of the New York State Ministers'
Wives and Ministers' Widows Association, Inc.

WHEREAS, Individuals who give of their time and energies and  serve  the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr. W. Ruth Whitney has given not only of her time and ener-
gies but also of her competence, intelligence and leadership and  conse-
quently has been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor  Dr.
W. Ruth Whitney upon the occasion of her Installation as the 13th Presi-
dent  of the New York State Ministers' Wives and Ministers' Widows Asso-
ciation, Inc. to be celebrated at its Installation of Officers  Ceremony
on  Thursday, October 28, 2010, at Mount Sinai Baptist Church, Brooklyn,
New York; her term as President will commence in January of 2011; and
  WHEREAS, The vision of the New York State Ministers' Wives and  Minis-
ters'  Widows  Association  is  to equip Ministers' Wives and Ministers'
Widows to win others to  Christ,  while  developing  and  nurturing  one
another as Disciples of Christ; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  W.  Ruth  Whitney's  term  will  focus on her desire to
further develop the unique sisterhood of the New York  State  Ministers'
Wives  and Ministers' Widows Association through celebration, education,
commemoration and participation; and
  WHEREAS, This prominent woman earned her Bachelor  of  Science  degree
from  the  New  York  State  University  in Westbury and her Master's in
Social Work from Adelphi University, Garden City, Long Island; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. W. Ruth Whitney is the First  Lady  of  the  Mount  Sinai
Baptist  Church  in Brooklyn, where her husband, The Reverend Dr. Curtis
L. Whitney, serves as its Pastor; and
  WHEREAS, She joined the New York State Ministers' Wives and Ministers'
Widows Association in 1975 and immediately began her journey of faithful
service to this prestigious organization; and
  WHEREAS, Under the leadership of the Fourth  President,  Dr.  W.  Ruth
Whitney  served  as Educational Workshop Facilitator; since then she has
been a diligent and faithful member, working  in  every  administration;
and
  WHEREAS,  From  1978-1983,  Dr.  W.  Ruth Whitney served as First Vice
President chairing the State Breakfast, where she originated "pre-regis-
tration"; and
  WHEREAS, Furthermore, Dr. W. Ruth  Whitney  served  as  the  Executive
Chair  and  then as Vice President until November 2001, when she stepped
aside to pursue political aspirations, becoming the only  Pastor's  wife
on  record to be placed on the ballot for New York Governmental Service;
and
  WHEREAS, Dr. W. Ruth Whitney's stewardship extends beyond the New York
state level; it is noteworthy  that  she  served  as  President  of  the
Baptist  Ministers' Wives and Widows of New York and Vicinity, the local
chapter where she is still an active member; and
  WHEREAS, Nevertheless, Dr. W. Ruth Whitney's presence is felt  on  the
International  level  as well; she served as the First National Chair of
the Herald Advertisement Committee  during  the  administration  of  Dr.
Shirley Hart; and
  WHEREAS,  She was the Special Administrative Assistant to Dean Cynthia
Ray and continued to serve as Discipline  Chair  during  Dean  Wheeler's

administration,  rising  to  the  level  of Assistant Dean of Education,
Chair of Records and Flags and Women's Affairs Committee; and
  WHEREAS,  Her outstanding leadership often propelled Dr. W. Ruth Whit-
ney to the forefront of movements that involved positive change as  well
as  necessary development, enhancing the quality of life in many diverse
communities throughout the Nation; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. W. Ruth Whitney has been the recipient of numerous awards
and accolades, some of which include: 2007  Woman  of  the  Year  Award;
named  a  2001  History-Maker  by the Allen Jordan Laymen Movement; 2001
Woman of Distinction; and in 1992, she was named Outstanding Personality
of the Week by NEW YORK NEWSDAY; and
  WHEREAS, Furthermore, Dr. W. Ruth Whitney has attained multiple accom-
plishments throughout her lifetime;  she  co-authored  SISTER-TO-SISTER,
DEVOTIONS  FOR AND FROM AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMEN, served as a board member
of the American Baptist Churches USA as well  as  chaired  the  Interna-
tional Ministries Working Group on African Affairs; and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  the  entire  period  of her community service, a
period of constructive  involvement,  Dr.  W.  Ruth  Whitney  has  stood
constant in dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS,  In  addition to her loving husband, with her throughout have
been her children as well as grandchildren, all of whom feel  privileged
to be a part of her life and rejoice in her achievements; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individ-
ual  for  the  benefit of others which Dr. W. Ruth Whitney has displayed
throughout her life; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Dr. W. Ruth Whitney upon the occasion of her Installation  as  the
13th  President  of  the  New York State Ministers' Wives and Ministers'
Widows Association, Inc.; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Dr. W. Ruth Whitney, Brooklyn, New York.
